New Records: Glenn Maxwell hit the fastest century in ICC World Cup history in 40 balls
Key Match Events: Australia hammered the Netherlands by 309 runs
Glenn Maxwell's ton came off just 40 balls
David Warner and Steve Smith smashed their respective half-centuries
Adam Zampa picked four wickets for eight runs in three overs
Logan van Beek dismissed Mitchell Marsh early to get a head start in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's win was the biggest in the World Cup in terms of margin of runs
Australia bettered their previous margin of World Cup victory -- against Afghanistan by 275 runs at Perth in 2015
Australia's campaign has been inconsistent. After initial losses to South Africa and India, the Aussies have now bounced back to defeat Pakistan and Sri Lanka
The Dutch have already proven to be formidable opponents, having defeated South Africa in the tournament's opening round

The Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium itself brings another layer of unpredictability to the contest. Once a paradise for spinners, the pitch has undergone a transformation. The introduction of black-soil pitches has balanced the scales, making it a batter-friendly ground
Australia coach Andrew McDonald said that the Netherlands had demonstrated their abilities in their match against South Africa, with several players in fine form
Post-Match Reflections: The margin of victory was the largest (by runs) in World Cup history and it sharply elevated Australia’s net run-rate from -0.193 to 1.142
Warner’s leaping catch at square leg to send back Sybrand Engelbrecht for 11 off Mitchell Marsh (2-19)
The highlight was Warner’s leaping catch at square leg to send back Sybrand Engelbrecht for 11 off Mitchell Marsh (2-19)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The margin of victory was the largest (by runs) in World Cup history
The Arun Jaitley Cricket Stadium has seen 14 matches won by the team batting first and an equal number by the team chasing, with one match ending inconclusively
Australia's campaign has been inconsistent. After initial losses to South Africa and India, the Aussies have now bounced back to defeat Pakistan and Sri Lanka
The Netherlands pacer Logan van Beek dismissed Mitchell Marsh early to get a head start in the game
Others: A moment of silence was observed for former Indian cricketer Bishan Singh Bedi, who passed away on October 23
